intro_text: The patrol wants to hold a training session for r_c. They decide to focus on how best hunt and hide while wading through cheek-deep water.
decline_text: They decide to focus on the patrolling the territory instead. Training can wait for another day.

r_c picks up the instruction quickly, and the patrol plays a small game of leapfrog within the shallow pools to test {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} abilities.

intro_text: Fireflies swarm over the heart of c_n's territory, gleaming, dancing, and flashing around app1 as {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/wait/waits} for app2.
decline_text: The apprentices are called back to camp to deal with kitsitting.

success_outcomes.text: A giggling app2 bursts out from cover, pouncing on app1 with claws sheathed. app1 rolls with the gentle blow and bats app2 off, bounding after {PRONOUN/app2/subject} with promises of getting {PRONOUN/app2/subject} back! On and on the chase goes, neither interested in winning it as they play under the light of the fireflies.

app2 emerges from the dark, trots up to app1, and asks why {PRONOUN/app1/subject} wanted to meet there. app1 looks away with a purr, making up some nonsense about trying to catch the fireflies. Both apprentices hang out under the swarm of light, awkward and thrilled.

app2 emerges, the lights of the swarm reflected in {PRONOUN/app2/poss} eyes. Seeing s_c, {PRONOUN/app2/subject} {VERB/app2/ask/asks} why s_c wanted to meet there. Stuttering but determined, s_c explains that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} wondered if, possibly, maybe, app2 would like to hang out together... just the two of them? app2 looks away with a purr, mumbling a soft yes to the ground.

fail_outcomes.text: app2 refuses to come out into the night, and app1 gives up on {PRONOUN/app1/poss} idea, disappointed {PRONOUN/app1/subject} didn't get to spend time with app2.

decline_text: r_c declines gently, explaining that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} too much work to do.

success_outcomes.text: The cats go out together late in the day, when the swamp seems made of shadows. r_c goes through {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tricks, showing p_l how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/use/uses} the direction of the sun to avoid casting a shadow on pools as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fish/fishes}, as p_l watches with eyes that r_c notices are a bit too admiring for what's just a little trick. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/smirk/smirks}, showing off a little.

It's a long but satisfying training session, giving both cats the chance to test themselves and work on their skills. It ends with them sitting on a little outlook, watching the sun go down and catching the last of its rays on their pelts. r_c sees p_l watching {PRONOUN/r_c/object} instead of the sunset and smiles.

s_c is a fantastic hunter, and p_l isn't shy about telling {PRONOUN/s_c/object} so. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/blush/blushes}, but {VERB/s_c/work/works} through it, showing p_l how to use the scraps of old crowfood from the fresh-kill pile to attract fish, frogs, newts, salamanders, and other squishy things in the murky pools.

p_l marvels at the opportunity to have s_c's time to {PRONOUN/p_l/self}. s_c is such a popular cat, so friendly and fun to be around, and yet when the training session draws to a close under the setting sun, s_c looks surprised to be told so.

intro_text: app1 crouches low behind some grass, searching for the ideal prey to fall to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} deadly claws. In front of the mighty hunter, a brightly colored beetle alights on a rock.

Ha! app1 leaps, tail lashing as the beetle buzzes under {PRONOUN/app1/poss} paws. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/bat/bats} the bug off the rock and onto the ground, then {VERB/app1/pounce/pounces} after it. app1 jumps and twists as {PRONOUN/app1/poss} colorful prey flits around {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head in typical concussed beetle fashion, unused to being an apprentice's new favorite toy.

s_c pounces, flipping the beetle with soft paws and flopping over onto {PRONOUN/app1/poss} back. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/watch/watches} the insect scurry from one paw to the other, so entranced by its color and tiny, perfect legs that {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/don't/doesn't} notice {PRONOUN/app1/poss} own skill in catching and keeping the bug.

Slimy, yet satisfying! Curiosity completed, app1 wanders off - but has to report to the medicine den later, when {PRONOUN/app1/poss} stomach reminds {PRONOUN/app1/object} why cats don't eat random bugs.

intro_text: p_l holds up their tail and freezes in place. app1 swallows {PRONOUN/app1/poss} terror as the ground rumbles ominously beneath them. Crouching down, following p_l's guidance, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/stare/stares} in awe as a giant, hulking beast with tree branches on its head emerges from the swamp.

success_outcomes.text: Once upon a time, p_l murmurs, voice barely a whisper, Twolegs attacked the wetlands, ripping down trees, choking off rivers, and reshaping the earth itself. Seeing the destruction, the stars blessed the fallen trees to rise, undead and massive, and drive the Twolegs from the swamps. Moose are very dangerous - but their presence shields c_n.

As the gigantic moose wanders by, p_l quietly begins to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tale. The ancestors of the Clans were starving. They almost gave up settling in the swamp, but then they came across a battle between two giants. A wolf brought down a moose and left after eating its fill. The cats were able to survive off the remaining meat, and some cats still live amongst its bones!

fail_outcomes.text: app1's courage falters in the sight of such a huge animal. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/try/tries} to run from it, but p_l pins {PRONOUN/app1/object} to the ground lest the sudden movement startle the moose. One blow from those big hooves would easily kill a cat.

intro_text: It's been a hard swimming lesson - app1 has just fallen back in, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/try/tries} to clamber out with {PRONOUN/app1/poss} claws dug into a tree root. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} looking particularly sorry for {PRONOUN/app1/self}, so p_l suggests they take a break; {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/have/has} a story to share. Does app1 know why c_n lives in the quagmire?
decline_text: No, and though {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} polite, app1 doesn't want to hear about it. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'d/'s} just like some help drying off.

success_outcomes.text: Long ago, rebels were driven from their former Clans and sought a new life. But the lands were crowded with other cats, vicious and territorial, and the refugees were chased beyond land and familiarity. It was only in the waters that others cringed from where they found safety. c_n remembers those lessons still and treasures their swamps for the safety they provide.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l tries to share the long ago history of the safe refuge the swamps offered - but app1 throws back {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head and yowls. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/don't/doesn't} care what some ancient cat did; {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/hate/hates} this. Water is awful!

Long ago, rebels were driven from their former Clans and sought a new life, p_l begins. But app1 interrupts {PRONOUN/p_l/object} - so these rebels were too cowardly to fight? The exiles should've attacked and taken over, not surrendered and run.

intro_text: As the patrol shares tongues, p_l asks if they'd like to hear the tale of The Greedy Raven and the Snake.
decline_text: Instead, p_l detangles a stubborn knot of fur for r_c.

success_outcomes.text: Long ago, a leader's son pursued his father's approval and attention by murdering his deputies. But his last victim's mate, a queen nursing the kits of the dead deputy, rose from her nest and struck back with the fury of a mother viper. If the leader's son had been willing to wait for power to come to him, he would've been a great leader. Instead, his ghost lurks in the Dark Forest.

fail_outcomes.text: The cats aren't interested in hearing p_l's historical tale, and p_l tries not to let {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} ears fall in disappointment.

intro_text: Alright, listen up, p_l orders. It's not a fun tale, but apprentices need to learn about the bog. And, er... the bodies...
decline_text: On second thought, app1 looks a bit nervous. p_l will wait to explain this until another, happier, day.

success_outcomes.text: In the heartbreaking event that a Clanmate is lost and you're nearby, p_l explains seriously, you cannot leave their body in the wetlands. Their body and spirit will both sink into the murk, the bog will take them, and they'll never be able to find their way to StarClan.

In the heartbreaking event that a Clanmate is lost and you're nearby, p_l explains seriously, you cannot leave their body in the wetlands. Bodies don't decay in the bog. It traps the spirit deep in its murky depths...

fail_outcomes.text: p_l starts to talk about undecaying bodies lying in bogs, and that's... a bit beyond what the apprentices can handle, it turns out.

intro_text: Poking their noses out of camp at night (which they're definitely not supposed to do), app1 and app2 spot something glowing among the trees...
decline_text: On second thought, camp is great, and they want to stay there.

success_outcomes.text: One heartbeat passes. Then another. The light doesn't change. s_c creeps forward, whiskers aquiver. It's a mushroom! A gift from passing spirits, s_c bets, left to light their way through the swamp!

One heartbeat passes. Then another. The light doesn't change. s_c creeps forward, whiskers aquiver. It's a mushroom! s_c has heard of these; StarClan once left a trail to guide c_n cats out of danger during a disaster!

fail_outcomes.text: It's too weird. app1 refuses to go near the light and almost gets them caught sneaking back into camp with how much {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} panicking.
